meanings.definition: To write or draw hastily and carelessly.
meanings.sent1: She scraveled a quick note before rushing out the door.
meanings.sent2: The student scraveled his assignment at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: In her rush, she scraveled a messy doodle on the paper.
meanings.sent4: His pen scraveled across the page like a frantic spider.
meanings.sent5: The child scraveled his name in big, shaky letters.

meanings.definition: To move in a hurried, confused manner.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel scraveled up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent2: The crowd scraveled in all directions after the loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The puppy scraveled around the room, knocking things over.
meanings.sent4: The leaves scraveled along the ground in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The ants scraveled in a chaotic line across the sidewalk.
